alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Upper Sevier River Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN PIUTE...CENTRAL GARFIELD...SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE AND CENTRAL KANE COUNTIES... At 159 PM MST...an area of heavy snow was 15 miles west of Escalante...moving northeast at 20 mph. Locations impacted include... Escalante, Junction, Capitol Reef National Park, Loa, Bicknell, Boulder, Torrey, Antimony, Teasdale, Circleville, Lyman, Kingston, Angle and Fruita. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 156 and 168. Utah Route 12 between mile markers 34 and 122. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 53 and 90. * winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow. * snowfall accumulation of 1 to 3 inches is expected in this area of heavy snow through 4 PM MST.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Upper Sevier River Valleys
